  • Reference Manual
  • Resources Definitions
  • Network

Network resource

Networks groups a set of devices into one logical unit.

Networks provides some default settings like types and provisioning, and the ability to restrict access using ACL's.

  • key – The unique identifier for the network
  • parents – A set of entities with access to the network, each entity is a string in the form<type>/<resource>. Example organization/tinymesh oruser/demo@tiny-mesh.com
  • address – A unsigend 32-bit integer representing the Tinymesh NID (encoded as big-endian)
  • name – A UTF-8 encoded string used for humans to identify the network.
  • location – A set of user defined tags for location, each tag must be UTF-8 encoded and maximum 32 bytes long. Maximum size of the set is 32 items.
  • provision.default – The default provisioning, the modes are described in devices
  • provision.type – The default type for automatically created devices
  • devices – A list of device keys in the network
  • channels – A list of available channels
  • groups – A list of groups (maximum 256) available for multicast, currently unsupported.
  • types – A set of types (defaults to end-device, gateway and device) used to differentiate between different devices.
  • meta.created – ISO 8601 datetime of creation
  • meta.updated – Last updates ISO 8601 datetime
